stimulusHtml:
Part A
The graph of h and its dashed midline for two full cycles is shown. Five points, F, G, J, K, and P, are labeled on the graph. No scale is indicated, and no axes are presented.

Determine possible coordinates t,ht for the five points: F, G, J, K, and P.

  • Moving from left to right:
    • Point F is at a maximum point.
    • Point G is on the midline.
    • Point J is at a minimum point.
    • Point K is on the midline.
    • Point P is at a maximum point.
  • The center of the clockface is represented by a small circle. 
  • Extending from the center are two hands that point to numbers on the clock. One of the hands is labeled Hour Hand.
  • The clockwise rotation direction for the Hour Hand is indicated.
  • Numbers on the clock are located near the clock’s perimeter. The numbers divide the clock into 12 sectors or sections. The number directly above the center is 12. Moving from the 12 to the right in a clockwise direction, the numbers appear as follows.
    • 1
    • 2
    • 3, which is directly to the right of the center
    • 4
    • 5
    • 6, which is directly below the center
    • 7
    • 8
    • 9, which is directly to the left of the center
    • 10
    • 11
    • and back to 12
  • Note that the figure is not drawn to scale.

features.html:
• The center of the clockface is represented by a small circle. 
  • Extending from the center are two hands that point to numbers on the clock. One of the hands is labeled Hour Hand.
  • The clockwise rotation direction for the Hour Hand is indicated.
  • Numbers on the clock are located near the clock’s perimeter. The numbers divide the clock into 12 sectors or sections. The number directly above the center is 12. Moving from the 12 to the right in a clockwise direction, the numbers appear as follows.
    • 1
    • 2
    • 3, which is directly to the right of the center
    • 4
    • 5
    • 6, which is directly below the center
    • 7
    • 8
    • 9, which is directly to the left of the center
    • 10
    • 11
    • and back to 12
  • Note that the figure is not drawn to scale.

The figure shows a clock standing on a level floor with a close-up view of the clockface. The clockface has a 10-centimeter-long hour hand that moves as time passes. The center of the clockface is 200 centimeters from the floor. At time t=0 hours, the hour hand is pointing directly up to the 12. The next time the hour hand points directly up to the 12 is at time t=12 hours. As the hour hand moves, the distance of the endpoint of the hour hand from the floor periodically decreases and increases.

The sinusoidal function h models the distance, in centimeters, of the endpoint of the hour hand from the floor as a function of time t, in hours.

stimulusHtml:
Part B

The function h can be written in the form ht=asinbt+c+d. Find values of constants a, b, c, and d.

The figure shows a clock standing on a level floor with a close-up view of the clockface. The clockface has a 10-centimeter-long hour hand that moves as time passes. The center of the clockface is 200 centimeters from the floor. At time t=0 hours, the hour hand is pointing directly up to the 12. The next time the hour hand points directly up to the 12 is at time t=12 hours. As the hour hand moves, the distance of the endpoint of the hour hand from the floor periodically decreases and increases.

The sinusoidal function h models the distance, in centimeters, of the endpoint of the hour hand from the floor as a function of time t, in hours.

stimulusHtml:
Part C
Refer to the graph of h in part A. The t-coordinate of J is t1, and the t-coordinate of K is t2.

(i) On the interval t1,t2, which of the following is true about h ?

     a. h is positive and increasing.

     b. h is positive and decreasing.

     c. h is negative and increasing.

     d. h is negative and decreasing.

(ii) On the interval t1,t2, describe the concavity of the graph of \(h\) and determine whether the rate of change of \(h\) is increasing or decreasing.
